thread.title: Top-seeded Wawrinka wins Japan Open for 4th title of year
thread.title_full: Top-seeded Wawrinka wins Japan Open for 4th title of year

title: Top-seeded Wawrinka wins Japan Open for 4th title of year
text:
Top-seeded Wawrinka beats Paire to win 4th title of year at Japan Open 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS October 11, 2015 - 2:29 am EDT 
TOKYO — French Open champion Stan Wawrinka defeated Benoit Paire 6-2, 6-4 on Sunday to win the Japan Open for his career-best fourth title of the season. 
The top-seeded Wawrinka was in control from the outset and secured the win in 65 minutes when the unseeded Paire double-faulted on match point. Stan Wawrinka of Switzerland holds up the championship trophy after defeating Benoit Paire of France in the championship match of the Japan Open menâ€™s tennis tournament in Tokyo, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. (AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko) 
In addition to Roland Garros, Wawrinka has won titles this season at Chennai and Rotterdam. He improved to 5-1 against Paire, who upset local favorite Kei Nishikori in the semifinals. 
Paire, who struggled with a sore left ankle, was broken four times and committed 12 unforced errors in the match. 
Wawrinka is the first Swiss winner in Tokyo since Roger Federer in 2006.
